intro: Alcantarea tortuosa, commonly known as the "Coral Cactus," is a striking succulent native to Brazil. It features a tall, branching stem covered in dense, coral-pink spines that give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique structure and vibrant color, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
